official-title.#text:
To require a report on procurement supply chain vulnerabilities within the Department of 
Defense.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Report on procurement supply chain vulnerabilities

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Committees on Armed Services of the Senate

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: a report on how sole source suppliers of components to the

procurement supply chain create vulnerabilities to
			 military attack, terrorism, natural disaster, industrial shock, financial
			 crisis, or geopolitical crisis, such as an embargo of key raw materials or
			 industrial inputs.

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the
The report required by subsection (a) shall include, at a minimum, the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
procurement supply chain for which there is a
			 supplier that controls over 50 percent of the global market.

text.#text: A list of the components in the

A list of parts of the supply chain where there is inadequate information to ascertain whether
			 there is a single source supplier of components.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
recommendations on which single source suppliers create vulnerabilities, as well as
			 recommendations on how to reduce those vulnerabilities.

text.#text: The report required by subsection (a) may be classified.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 5855 IH: To require a report on procurement supply chain vulnerabilities within the Department of Defense.
